messages: 000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (23:52): can i create a zone and install suse this system?  it is running sol 10 6/06 x86 on x4100
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (23:55): axisys, you need to install the brandz (janus) patches to install linux in a zone
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (23:55): jamesd: so in other words i cant..
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (23:55): woohoo. numa observability tools just went back
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (23:56): jamesd: since i am running sol 10 6/06 x86 which is not ready for brandz
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (23:56): axisys, brandz hasn't been included into an official solaris release "YET!"
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (23:57): jamesd: oh well.. thats cool
5a2f1c3667886a3c922e7ad2f06ca9b8 (23:57): stevel, went back? do lgrpinfo et al are now in nevada ?
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (23:58): mrdeviant: yup. lgrpinfo, plgrp, pmap -L, and pmadvise
6b3eb9288618d195ee7609ba9e84b63c (23:58): does anyone knows if pkgmk sources are included into opensolaris ?
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (23:58): axisys, if you don't need performance you can get  qemm that will run solaris inside  Solaris
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (23:58): er linux inside solaris
4728836dd20fbbd42df173378704e9ce (23:58): stevel: great!
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (23:58): milek: http://www.opensolaris.org/os/community/performance/numa/observability/
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (23:58): i was the test person for that project before i joined the opensolaris team
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (23:59): stevel, do you know in what version of SX:CR they will be included in?
5a2f1c3667886a3c922e7ad2f06ca9b8 (23:59): any info on if/when they'll get back ported to S10 ?
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (23:59): jamesd: b49
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (00:00): mrdeviant: s10u4
5a2f1c3667886a3c922e7ad2f06ca9b8 (00:02): it'll be nice to have them bundled with S10, since i don't think sun ships a non-numa 2+ socket machine atm
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (00:02): I thought u45 wasn't.
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (00:03): u45 is i believe
72bac19ca0a2ff15f99326a8f7e02c10 (00:03): that'll teach me to trust my memory.
5a2f1c3667886a3c922e7ad2f06ca9b8 (00:03): us3i has an on-board memory controller, so it's numa
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (00:04): stevel, if i have a uma box and bge and a  quad (non trunking compatible) ehternet card  will observability stuff help me much?
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (00:04): jamesd: observability doesn't help much on a uma system, regardless of NICs
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (00:04): well, i mean. you can observe that everything is UMA
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (00:04): but that's not terribly interesting :)
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:14): jamesd: qemm ?
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (00:14): oh wait its  qemu ... i always make that mistake
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:14): i think u meant qemu
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:14): duh!
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:14): hehe
5a2f1c3667886a3c922e7ad2f06ca9b8 (00:14): wasn't qemm an old DOS program ?
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:14): so is there a CSW version of that.. i am greedy
a52cfbb622e51e16f2dd4351288d4374 (00:17): mrdeviant: a memory manager i believe
5a2f1c3667886a3c922e7ad2f06ca9b8 (00:18): i have vague memories of that, pardon the pun
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:18): looks like there is one qemu CSW pkg
7ef291c89ad915978b203d427919cfbb (00:26): yeap, martin made it, the creator of martux.
e1eed1422abe5a0ecc40b2f6e68efadf (00:26): can the ultra 45 take 500GB drives?  the x64 ultra 40 can, but sun.com lists 250GB as the max for the sparc workstation.
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:29): anyone used rsnapshot
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:30): looks pretty cool for simple backups
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:30): uses rsync basically and very easy to restore
dee88f7f1080715bdb078c4efda912e6 (00:30): i use it
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:30): xinkeT: how do u like it
dee88f7f1080715bdb078c4efda912e6 (00:30): it's fine for simple stuff.. i'm using it for really large data sets (upwards of 1TB) and it has its problems.  I'm moving to ZFS snapshots
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:32): i need to backup some of the data from old system to my X4100 sol 10 u2 .. could i use zfs snapshot for nfs filesystem?
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:32): if yes i rather use that
dee88f7f1080715bdb078c4efda912e6 (00:32): depends on whether the filesystem is zfs or not
dee88f7f1080715bdb078c4efda912e6 (00:32): i.e on the nfs server
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:32): this backup has be done daily or weekly
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:32): xinkeT: its not
dee88f7f1080715bdb078c4efda912e6 (00:32): then no, you can't
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:33): hmm.. ok i really dont have as much data as u do.. so let me give this a try
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:33): rsnapshot that is
dee88f7f1080715bdb078c4efda912e6 (00:33): you can use rsnapshot for that, but then you have to be concerned about open files
fa431de24e4af63e92b560fbb4c99d34 (00:34): rsync sometimes takes too long building file lists... i wouldnt use it for >10K files
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:34): i am going to backup the netapp's daily snapshots,, no no worry of open files
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:35): OT: coreutils keep gnu cp ?
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:35): or is it binutils?
000d10e6d03eeb8a50a6feed67578cbe (00:36): i am on sol 10 u2
